Precise BioMatch FLEX-H Toolkit Documentation
PreciseBiometrics.BMFH Namespace
Send Feedback
Precise BioMatch FLEX-H Toolkit 1.4.0
 

Classes

  ClassDescription
BioMatch
Contains all biometric toolkit functions.
BM_BioReaders
Preset hardcoded reader set for use without scanning for available readers.
BM_BioTemplate
Base class for BioMatch for Windows templates.
BM_Error
A class for handling error codes.
BM_Image
BioMatch internal image representation object.
BM_Reader
The Biometric Reader Class.
BMFH_Template
The BioMatch storage template object for BioMatch FLEX-H templates. This template type provides the carrier for all types of template information required to handle enrolment and verification operations. Enrolment templates contain both the biometric header and the reference data to be written to the BioMatch enabled smart card. Verification templates contain the validation data which is to be sent to the card for it to perform the matching/verification operation. Biometric header templates contain only the biometric header read from the card and are used to generate appropriate validation data for the specific card used. All these template instances have the same object structure and can be stored together as the same type.

Delegates

  DelegateDescription
BioMatch..::.BiometricEventHandler
Description of the function parameter syntax to use for user functions that will be notified by the BiometricCallback event.

Enumerations

  EnumerationDescription
BM_FarLevel
The FAR security levels available.
BM_Finger
Enumeration of the fingers allowed according to ANSI/NIST-ITL 1. The actual values can be acquired by casting an enumerated finger to a byte.
BM_ImageCondition
The condition of an analyzed image.
BM_ImagePresent
Whether an image is present or not in the image.
BM_PixelFormat
Enumerated type BioMatchPixelFormat.
BM_ReaderTypes
Listing of known biometric reader types
BM_ReturnCode
Listing of possible return codes. The usual response to a successful execution is Ok. If a cancel command has been issued in a callback context, the function will return the Cancelled value upon exit. If a function returns TimedOut, then it could not complete its function in the alotted time period. The Reader error is returned if there was a problem accessing the reader specified to perform the requested function.
BM_Sensor
Enumerated type BioMatchSensor
BM_StatusOption
Finger status return data options.
TemplateType
The template type list
